fallow adjective
(LAND)

Fallow land is not planted with crops, in order to improve the quality of the soil: lie fallow Farmers are eligible for government support if they let a certain amount of land lie fallow.

fallow adjective
(TIME)
A fallow period of time is one in which very little happens: fallow period After a long fallow period, the author has brought out a new book.

fallow land is land that a farmer does not grow crops on for a period of time, usually a year, so that the soil quality can improve
used to describe a period of time in which there is not much business activity: The corporation has gained market share recently, but only after a long fallow period.
